Award.AwardTitle: Need-Based Sponsorship of Student Travel to IEEE MASS 2015; October 19-22, 2015; Dallas, TX

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: This award is to provide 20 need-based student travel grants to the International Conference on Mobile Ad hoc and Sensor Systems (IEEE MASS), in Dallas, Texas, Oct 19-22, 2015. Travel grants for the conference and also to support pre-conference workshops will be offered to interested young researches in the field of wireless, mobile, and sensing technology and systems, who otherwise would not have the opportunity to attend. The conference traditionally brings together researchers in the broad field of wireless, mobile and sensor systems including distributed signal processing, cyber-physical applications, networked services, architectural considerations, sensing systems, network middleware, platform design, and system resource management to facilitate intellectual exchange and expose students to first-class research in these areas.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This grant supported need-based travel of eligible graduate students from US institutions of higher learning to the IEEE International Conference on Mobile Ad hoc and Sensor Systems (IEEE MASS). The IEEE International Conference on Mobile Ad hoc and Sensor Systems is an annual systems conference sponsored by the IEEE Computer Society. It publishes original research on wireless, mobile, and sensing systems that have applications in a variety of contexts, from smart cities to battlefields and from environmental monitoring to disaster-recovery operations. It accepts papers on alternative paradigms for connectivity in both urban and rural areas, and offers an opportunity for publishing results on novel topics such as cyber-physical systems and the Internet of Things. The conference traditionally brings together researchers in the broad field of wireless, mobile and sensor systems including distributed signal processing, cyber-physical applications, networked services, architectural considerations, network middleware, platform design, and system resource management. An announcement of travel funding was made at the conference website. From among the applicants, twenty-two (22) eligible winners were selected for the award, and received a registration waiver to attend the conference. By providing such need-based student travel support to IEEE MASS, the grant facilitated intellectual exchange and exposed awarded students to first-class research in their field.  IEEE MASS was held in Dallas, USA, Oct 19-22, 2015. The PI of this proposal was the General Chair.
